sense.name: an increase in salary
sense.examples: The best employees received a ten percent raise last year. John went to his boss and asked for a raise.

sense.name: an upward slope or rise
sense.examples: The road's steep raise made it strenuous to go uphill on a bicycle.

sense.name: an increase in a bet or bid
sense.commentary: RAISE[+quantity][+increase][+bet][+game] Note: can refer to money (as in poker) but to cards (in bridge)
sense.examples: I'll see your raise and double it. Mary was surprised at her bridge partner's raise to eight clubs.

sense.name: the act of lifting something
sense.examples: He questioned her remark with a raise of his eyebrow. The athlete demonstrated some bent-over raises of free weights. The sailors' raise of the spinnaker was done skillfully.
